metadata.name: The devil kiss on the Zahak's shoulders
metadata.description:
Zahak is the mythical king of Iran who is known for his oppression and the story is mentioned in Shahnameh. Shahnameh is one of the most important epic texts in the world and is considered as an Iranian Iliad and Odyssey. The Devil kisses Zahak's shoulders and on the spots of his kisses, snakes come out on his shoulders. 
Zahhak was terrified and didn't know what to do with the snakes. Devil appeared to him as a physician. 
He told Zahhak that the only way to control the snakes is to feed them with two human brain every day otherwise the snakes would eat Zahhak himself.  
So Zahhak started killing young men and feeding their brains to the evil snakes...

attributes.value: The devil kiss on the Zahak's shoulders
